title: Postpartum Hemorrhage Simulation Training: Instructional Design-Based Long-Term Transfer Effect Enhancement Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic obstetrics and gynecology clinical knowledge and fundamental emergency care skills
context.additional_context: Internal training program for medical device companies, providing simulation content mirroring real clinical environments. BYOD configurations per learner and utilization of collaborative tools within the LMS

learning_goals: Apply a standardized protocol in postpartum hemorrhage emergencies with 90% accuracy
Improve role distribution efficiency among team members by 40% using communication skills acquired through simulation
Reduce judgment errors in real clinical environments by 25% by assessing situational awareness capabilities
Over 80% of participants present practical application cases during post-evaluation through LMS-based project deliverables
Quantitatively demonstrate that instructional design-based simulation training outperforms traditional methods in long-term transfer effects
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
